Class NeatGenome<T>

Represents a NEAT genome, i.e the genetic representation of a neural network.

ConnectionGenes

Connection genes data structure. These define both the neural network structure/topology and the connection weights.

Declaration

Type Description
ConnectionGenes<T>
| Improve this Doc View Source

ConnectionIndexMap

Cached info related to acyclic digraphs only.

Represents a mapping between genome connection indexes (in NeatGenome.ConnectionGenes), to reordered connections based on depth based node index allocations (as utilised in DirectedGraphAcyclic).

This allows for mapping of weights from NeatGenome.ConnectionGenes to the re-ordered weight array used by the neural net implementation (AcyclicNeuralNet).

The mapping is in the form of an array of indexes into NeatGenome.ConnectionGenes, i.e. the position in the index is the 'new' index (the digraph index), and the value stored at that position is the 'old' index (the genome connection index).

Declaration
public int[]? ConnectionIndexMap { get; }
Property Value
Type Description
int[]
| Improve this Doc View Source

DirectedGraph

The directed graph that the current genome represents.

Declaration
public DirectedGraph DirectedGraph { get; }
Property Value
Type Description
DirectedGraph
Remarks

This digraph mirrors the graph described by ConnectionGenes; this object represents the graph structure only, not the weights, and is therefore re-used when spawning genomes with the same structure (i.e. a child that is the result of connection weight mutations only). The DirectedGraph class provides an efficient means of working with graphs and is therefore made available on this class to provide improved performance for:

  • Decoding to a neural net object.
  • Finding new connections on acyclic graphs, i.e. detecting if a random new connection would form a cycle.

Note. When MetaNeatGenome.IsAcyclic is true then the object stored here will be of the subtype DirectedGraphAcyclic .

| Improve this Doc View Source

HiddenNodeIdArray

An array of hidden node IDs, sorted to allow efficient lookup of an ID with a binary search. Input and output node IDs are not included because these are allocated fixed IDs starting from zero and are therefore always known.

Declaration
public int[] HiddenNodeIdArray { get; }
Property Value
Type Description
int[]

NodeIndexByIdMap

Mapping function for obtaining a node index for a given node ID.

Declaration
public INodeIdMap NodeIndexByIdMap { get; }
Property Value
Type Description
INodeIdMap
Remarks

Node indexes have a range of 0 to N-1 (for N nodes), i.e. the indexes are zero based and contiguous; as opposed to node IDs, which are not contiguous.

| Improve this Doc View Source

GetDigraphWeightArray()

Gets an array of connection weights, ordered to match the connections of DirectedGraph.

Declaration
public T[] GetDigraphWeightArray()
Returns
Type Description
T[]

An array of connection weights.
Remarks

For cyclic genomes this is simply the genome's weight array, but for acyclic genomes the digraph and genome represent connections in a different order, thus for acyclic genomes/digraphs this method will return a new array with the weights in the digraph order.

Implements

IGenome
